Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: isn't doing z -> z like holding PIRATE on the second z, especially if you were only to send to another z? ü§î

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont understand the question

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all PIRATE tx are sending to zaddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we ignore the notarizations

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: if i send KMD t-.z, then z-z, and only send to z again, isn't it the same no t that PIRATE offers?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you don't have funds in t address for PIRATE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: except PIRATE has 7 million coins in z

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and all PIRATE tx just increase the anon set

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the difference is that there is no pool of transparent tx in PIRATE for any cross correlations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we assume you are not sending to notary addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted doing a t->z and z->z and keeping it in zaddr for a while is quite effective

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: is the pool of transparent txs relevant after z->z? really curious, not busting your balls üòÄ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as you are changing the total amounts when coming back out to taddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not relevant in zaddr, but the issue is the z->t

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now you can apply timing analysis and knapsack attacks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: PIRATE avoids this by not allowing z->t

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: definitely got it, thanks! üëç
